Model-Based Space Systems and Software Engineering MBSE 2025

5 November 2025 ‚Äì 7 November 2025

Innovation Agency Vilnius, Lithuania

Welcome to the Model-Based Space Systems and Software Engineering Workshop MBSE 2025

Model-Based Space Systems and Software Engineering (MB4SE) workshop is heading to Lithuania in 2025! üöÄ

With the support of the MB4SE Advisory Group, and Sensmetry, this prestigious event will further strengthen the Model-Based Systems Engineering (MBSE) community across the European space domain. And what better place to host it than Vilnius ‚Äì the vibrant capital of one of ESA‚Äôs Associated Member States!

üìÖ Save the Date: 5-7, November 2025

üìç Where: Vilnius, Lithuania

The call for workshops is already open! Submit your proposals by 15 March 2025.

We look forward to welcoming the MBSE community to Vilnius and showcasing Lithuania‚Äôs commitment to innovation and the space sector! üí°üåå

Call for Workshop and Training Session Proposals during MBSE2025 Vilnius

Space Hub LT at Innovation Agency Lithuania, the European Space Agency, in cooperation with the Model Based for System Engineering Advisory Group, and Sensmetry are excited to announce an open call for workshops and training sessions proposals to be featured at MBSE 2025 (5-7 Nov 2025, Vilnius). This multi-day event will bring together experts, practitioners, and enthusiasts for immersive training and collaborative work focused on Model-Based Systems Engineering (MBSE) with a specific focus on the space domain.

We invite proposals that emphasize practical learning, hands-on interaction, group work and engaging discussions.

‚ÄãEvent objectives: Accelerating the adoption and use of MBSE in the space domain

# Lowering adoption barriers

# Empowering the workforce

# Integration of tools and processes

How do we bridge the gap between top down (semantic definitions / ontologies) and bottom up (data exchange formats, tool focus)? How to bridge the gap between left and right-side of the V-model?

Session Types and Format‚Äã

Timeslots are available either as 1 hour or 2.5-hour slots for individual sessions. Larger sessions can be proposed by combining multiple 2.5h slots (at most three).

We are seeking proposals for:

  • How can we improve usability (visualization, analysis, reporting), emphasizing decision support aspects
  • What is the migration path (existing projects, existing data, existing processes, MBSE applied in specific context)
  • What skills are required (re-training, coaching, champions,‚Ä¶), bridging the gap between domain knowledge and MBSE expertise
  • Changing roles (interaction engineer ‚Äì system engineer ‚Äì project manager) and re-prioritize our use-cases as a function of experiences
  • Where do we need interoperability, and why
  • Enabling domain-specific activities in digital engineering workflows
  • Training Sessions: sessions focusing on MBSE tools, languages, and methodologies. Training sessions are intended to provide participants with skills and insights they can directly apply to their MBSE projects, focused on space mission development.‚Äã
  • Workshops: sessions (individually or in combined blocks) that encourage participant involvement and discussion. We encourage a broad interpretation of ‚Äúworkshop‚Äù and welcome the following formats:
  • Collaborative Group Work: Structured group exercises focusing on MBSE topics, addressing practical problems or other common challenges.‚Äã
  • Tool Application Sessions: Practical, hands-on workshops where participants work on MBSE projects or problems using specific tools or methodologies.‚Äã
  • Hackathons: Time-boxed challenges on MBSE problems or tasks, which may include a pre-workshop preparation phase and/or follow-up work (e.g. a pitch presentation at the end of the last day).‚Äã
  • Roundtable Discussions: Facilitated discussions where participants can share perspectives, solutions, and insights on MBSE-related issues.‚Äã
  • Other: We welcome unique approaches to MBSE education and collaboration. Feel free to propose innovative formats that you believe will engage participants effectively.‚Äã

Impact Orbit Creative Group

Impact Orbit Creative Group is a multi-disciplinary consultancy and innovation hub focused on driving sustainable growth, digital transformation, and impact-led strategies in the space and technology sectors. We partner with organisations and startups worldwide to deliver strategic guidance, communications expertise, and frameworks for responsible innovation.
